awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Large Sets of Disjoint Designs with  Holes
awd_abstract_narration: This award supports the research of Professor L. Teirlinck                 to work in combinatorics.  He intends to work on the large sets                 of disjoint designs and related structures.  In particular, he                  intends to continue his research on t-designs.                                       The research crosses lines between the areas of                            combinatorics, and coding theory.  Combinatorics attempts to find               efficient methods to study how discrete collections of objects                  can be organized.  And, so it is extremely important to modern                  communications, for example the design of large networks as in                  telephone systems.  The main object to be studied in the proposed               research, t-designs are a fundamental tool used in the                          foundations of authenticity theory in cryptography.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
